com.abmash.api
Class Browser

java.lang.Object
  com.abmash.api.Browser
All Implemented Interfaces:
Document
Direct Known Subclasses:
BrowserRunnable
public class Browser
extends java.lang.Object
implements Document

Main class for using a browser instance and interacting with it. You are encouraged to use more than one browser instance to interact with more than one page at a time. This can prove useful if you are switching between the same pages multiple times.

Examples:

  • browser.click("Save"); clicks on a link or button labeled Save
  • browser.type("Username", "Jack"); enter the text Jack in the input field labeled Username
  • browser.select("language", "english"); selects the options english in the dropdown/list labeled language
  • HtmlElement firstTitle = browser.query(headline()).findFirst(); finds the first title element on the current page and saves them
  • HtmlElements imagesLeftOfTitle = browser.query(image(), leftOf(title)).find(); finds all image elements left of the previously found title

Elements can be searched by queries to get their values and text, and to interact with them. Search queries are case-sensitive.

Use click(String) to search for elements with the specified name or label and click the best match.

Use type(String, String) to search for input elements (usually <input> or <textarea>, but also rich text editors used by many CMS, forums or blog applications) with the specified name or label, get the best match and enter the given text.

Use choose(String, String) to search for <select> elements (usually a dropdown selection or a box with a list of options) with the specified name or label, get the best match and select the given option from the list.

Use query(Predicate...) to create a Query instance and to search for HtmlElements. Predicates can be arbitrarily combined. The call of Query.find() or Query.findFirst() will return the result(s).

Found elements can be further interacted with, see HtmlElement.

Author:
Alper Ortac
See Also:
Query, HtmlElement, HtmlElements

Constructor Detail

Browser

public Browser()
Starts new browser session. Opens the browser and waits until it is ready.

The default browser configuration is the use of Firefox 4 and can be overwritten by creating a default.properties file. TODO explanation properties. For further customization see also Browser(String, BrowserConfig).

Each browser instance needs to be closed at the end of the program by calling the close() method. Use openUrl(String) to open another URL in the browser.

See Also:
close(), openUrl(String)

Browser

public Browser(java.lang.String url)
Starts new browser session. Opens the browser, loads the given URL and waits until it is ready.

The default browser configuration is the use of Firefox 4 and can be overwritten by creating a default.properties file. TODO explanation properties. For further customization see also Browser(String, BrowserConfig).

Each browser instance needs to be closed at the end of the program by calling the close() method. Use openUrl(String) to open another URL in the browser.

Parameters:
url - The URL to open, set to null to prevent loading a page
See Also:
close(), openUrl(String)

Browser

public Browser(java.lang.String url,
               BrowserConfig config)
Starts new browser session with specified BrowserConfig. Opens the browser, loads the given URL and waits until it is ready.

Each browser instance needs to be closed at the end of the program by calling the close() method. Use openUrl(String) to open another URL in the browser.

Parameters:
url - The URL to open, set to null to prevent loading a page
config - BrowserConfig instance
See Also:
close(), openUrl(String)
Method Detail

openUrl

public void openUrl(java.lang.String url)
Opens page with specified URL.

If there is more than one window open, the URL will be opened in current focused browser window.

Parameters:
url - the URL to open, null does not open a web page

Closes all browser windows and stops all browser interactions.

javaScript

public JavaScriptResult javaScript(java.lang.String script,
                                   java.lang.Object... args)
Loads JavaScript and evaluates it synchronously.

If needed, the jQuery library is automatically loaded.

Examples: 

 browser.javaScript("alert('info message');");
 JavaScriptResult result = browser.javaScript("return jQuery('#content').html();");

Parameters:
script - The script to run
Returns:
JavaScriptResult result object to retrieve the return value and type

javaScriptFromFile

public JavaScriptResult javaScriptFromFile(java.lang.String scriptFilename,
                                           java.lang.Object... args)
Reads JavaScript from a file and evaluates it synchronously.

The files need to be placed in the src/main/resources/js directory.

If needed, the jQuery library is automatically loaded.

Parameters:
scriptFilename - The script to load (without the file extension .js)
Returns:
JavaScriptResult result object to retrieve the return value and type

javaScriptAsync

public JavaScriptResult javaScriptAsync(java.lang.String script,
                                        java.lang.Object... args)
Loads JavaScript and evaluates it asynchronously.

If needed, the jQuery library is automatically loaded.

Examples: 

 browser.javaScriptAsync("alert('info message');");
 JavaScriptResult result = browser.javaScriptAsync("return jQuery('#content').html();");

Parameters:
script - The script to run
Returns:
JavaScriptResult result object to retrieve the return value and type

css

public Browser css(java.lang.String styleDefinitions,
                   java.lang.Boolean flatImageFolder,
                   java.lang.Object... args)
Reads CSS from a string and injects it into the current web page. Image urls are converted to binary data so that they can be displayed.

The image files need to be placed in the src/main/resources/images directory.

Parameters:
styleDefinitions - the stylesheet definitions
flatImageFolder - true if all images are in the same folder or false if the images are in the corresponding subfolders
Returns:
this browser instance

cssFromFile

public Browser cssFromFile(java.lang.String stylesheetFile,
                           java.lang.Boolean flatImageFolder,
                           java.lang.Object... args)
Reads CSS from a file and injects it into the current web page. Image urls are converted to binary data so that they can be displayed.

The css files need to be placed in the src/main/resources/css directory.

The image files need to be placed in the src/main/resources/images directory.

Parameters:
stylesheetFile - the stylesheet to load (without the file extension .css)
flatImageFolder - true if all images are in the same folder or false if the images are in the corresponding subfolders
Returns:
this browser instance

query

public Query query(Predicate... predicates)

click

public HtmlElement click(java.lang.String text)
Searches for a clickable element with specified query string and clicks it.

Example:

  • browser.click("Save"); clicks on a link or button labeled Save

Description:

Elements having an attribute value or visible text containing the query string will be added to the result set. The first result will be used for clicking. If you already have an HtmlElement instance use HtmlElement.click() instead.

Note that if the page reloads after a click, all found HtmlElement instances may lose their validity.

Parameters:
text - element attribute value or inner text containing this string
Returns:
HtmlElement to further interact with that element or null if element could not be found
See Also:
HtmlElement.click()

hover

public HtmlElement hover(java.lang.String text)
Searches for a element with specified query string and hovers it with the mouse.

Example:

  • browser.hover("News"); fires the "mouseover" event on the element labeled News

Description:

Elements having an attribute value or visible text containing the query string will be added to the result set. The first result will be used for hovering. If you already have an HtmlElement instance use HtmlElement.hover() instead.

Parameters:
text - element attribute value or inner text containing this string
Returns:
HtmlElement to further interact with that element or null if element could not be found
See Also:
HtmlElement.hover()

dragTo

public HtmlElement dragTo(java.lang.String textSource,
                          java.lang.String textTarget)
Searches for a element with specified query string and drags it with the mouse to another element.

Example:

  • browser.dragTo("Product", "Cart"); drags the element labeled Product to the element labeled Cart

Description:

Elements having an attribute value or visible text containing the query string will be added to the result set. The first result will be used for dragging. If you already have an HtmlElement instance use HtmlElement.dragTo(HtmlElement) instead.

Parameters:
textSource - source element attribute value or inner text containing this string
textTarget - target element attribute value or inner text containing this string
Returns:
HtmlElement to further interact with that element or null if element could not be found
See Also:
HtmlElement.dragTo(HtmlElement)

type

public HtmlElement type(java.lang.String query,
                        java.lang.String text)
Searches for element with specified query string and enters the text.

Example:

  • browser.type("location","New York").submit(); types in the text New York in the input field named or labeled location and then submits the form which contains that element.

Description:

Elements having an attribute value or visible text containing the query string will be added to the result set. The first result will be used for typing in the text. If you already have an HtmlElement instance use HtmlElement.type(String) instead. Use HtmlElement.submit() on the returned object to submit the form.

Parameters:
query - element attribute value or inner text containing this string
text - the text to type in
Returns:
HtmlElement to further interact with the form element, for instance to HtmlElement.submit() the form, or null if element could not be found
See Also:
HtmlElement.type(String)

choose

public HtmlElement choose(java.lang.String text,
                          java.lang.String option)
Searches for dropdown/list input field and selects the specified option. Use HtmlElement.submit() on the returned object to submit the form.

Example:

  • browser.choose("language","english").submit(); selects the english option from the list select field named or labeled language and then submits the form which contains that element.

Description:

TODO Select description

Parameters:
text - dropdown/select element
option - the attribute value or text of the option to choose for selecting
Returns:
HtmlElement to further interact with the form element, for instance to HtmlElement.submit() the form, or null if element could not be found

                            java.lang.String option)

Example:

  • browser.unchoose("language","english").submit(); deselects the english option from the list select field named or labeled language and then submits the form which contains that element.

chooseDate

public HtmlElement chooseDate(java.lang.String text,
                              org.joda.time.DateTime dateTime)
Searches for calendar/date picker input fields and selects the specified date. Use HtmlElement.submit() on the returned object to submit the form.

Example:

  • browser.chooseDate("Arrival", new Date()).submit(); selects the specified date in the date picker named or labeled Arrival and then submits the form which contains that element.

Description:

TODO Select description

Parameters:
text - calendar/date picker element
dateTime - the date to select
Returns:
HtmlElement to further interact with the form element, for instance to HtmlElement.submit() the form, or null if element could not be found

submit

public HtmlElement submit(java.lang.String text)
Submits the form, which contains the given form element.

Example:

  • browser.submit("address"); submits the form which contains the form element labeled address.

Parameters:
text - form input element
Returns:
HtmlElement to further interact with the form element or null if element could not be found

getWebDriver

public org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver getWebDriver()
Gets underlying Selenium WebDriver instance.

The WebDriver is internally used to do all interactions with the browser. In general, it is not necessary to use this manually.

Returns:
Selenium WebDriver
